title: [Self-Directed] Social Inquiry in a 3D Virtual World Using Multi-Spatial Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geography and social studies knowledge, experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Project-based learning connecting 3D virtual worlds with physical spaces in mixed reality environments using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Students can design learning scenarios connecting geographical spaces and social phenomena using 3D virtual worlds (e.g., Google Earth).
Learners can produce multi-space learning materials by integrating mobile AR applications and web-based platforms (e.g., Moodle).
Students can write and present analytical reports on social issues based on exploration results in 3D virtual spaces.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
